Choscura

Is tolerance really all you guys want? I've tolerated a lot of colds, and you tolerate sitting between two fat people in third-class seating on an airplane. Is that really how you want to be seen? As something other people have to put up with? That doesn't make much sense. Shouldn't you (the gay community) be promoting acceptance?
BobNelson2

Is tolerance really all you guys want? I've tolerated a lot of colds, and you tolerate sitting between two fat people in third-class seating on an airplane. Is that really how you want to be seen? As something other people have to put up with? That doesn't make much sense. Shouldn't you (the gay community) be promoting acceptance?

 
 We do, and it's largely worked. But some folks will never accept us, and frankly, after putting up with this **** for almost three decades, I'll look for acceptance, even celebration, from the people and environments where I've already found it. 
 
 I couldn't give a rat's XXX if people I no longer have any respect for accept me or not. 
 
 BUT I do expect them to tolerate me. Just like they "tolerate" racial minorities and people of other faiths (or no faith). 
 
 "Tolerance" is the only thing that society can require.... that law can compel.
Dzeron

Is tolerance really all you guys want? I've tolerated a lot of colds, and you tolerate sitting between two fat people in third-class seating on an airplane. Is that really how you want to be seen? As something other people have to put up with? That doesn't make much sense. Shouldn't you (the gay community) be promoting acceptance?

 
 IMO acceptance is too much to ask. You can't force straights to accept homosexuality for the same reasons that you can't force gays to accept heterosexuality. It's a violation of freedom either way.
 
 Tolerance, on the other hand, provides liberty for both sides.
MrWriteLA

You can't force straights to accept homosexuality for the same reasons that you can't force gays to accept heterosexuality. 

 
 Gays "don't accept" heterosexuality?? They're trying to deny heterosexuals their rights? Go "eww" whenever they see a heterosexual couple holding hands? Claim that heterosexuality is a sin, an abomination, a sickness? Bash them with baseball bats, crucify them on barbed wire in lonely Kansas fields, set them aflame on piles of tires? Picket their funerals with signs that say God hates them and they deserve to go to hell? Push for legislation that will prevent them from legally marrying? Blast them at every opportunity from their gay churches and on their gay cable networks? Fire them from jobs and deny them housing because they're straight? Protest because schools offer curricula depicting heterosexual couples? Boycott networks because they show a man and a woman kissing on TV? Try to force straight people to cure themselves of their "straightness" and become gay?
 
 Wow, have I been out of the loop! I had no idea!
epaphras_faith

"Tolerance" is the only thing that society can require.... that law can compel.

 
 Tolerance cannot be legislated. Equal protection under the law can. But tolerance is an attitude and you cannot legislate attitudes.
BobNelson2

Tolerance cannot be legislated. Equal protection under the law can. But tolerance is an attitude and you cannot legislate attitudes.

 
 You are playing word games.
 
 But fine, I'll take equal rights.
Dzeron

Gays "don't accept" heterosexuality?? They're trying to deny heterosexuals their rights? Go "eww" whenever they see a heterosexual couple holding hands? Claim that heterosexuality is a sin, an abomination, a sickness? Bash them with baseball bats, crucify them on barbed wire in lonely Kansas fields, set them aflame on piles of tires? Picket their funerals with signs that say God hates them and they deserve to go to hell? Push for legislation that will prevent them from legally marrying? Blast them at every opportunity from their gay churches and on their gay cable networks? Fire them from jobs and deny them housing because they're straight? Protest because schools offer curricula depicting heterosexual couples? Boycott networks because they show a man and a woman kissing on TV? Try to force straight people to cure themselves of their "straightness" and become gay?
 
 Wow, have I been out of the loop! I had no idea!

 
 That is intolerance, not non-acceptance. Intolerance is the use of force. Non-acceptance is holding a view that such a lifestyle is evil, but using words, rather than force, to convince people of this. Religious nuts should be allowed to shout their threats of hell and such - we have free speech, after all - but they shouldn't be allowed to form angry mobs and lynch gays, or get the State to deprive rights, or violate civil liberties in any way.
MrWriteLA

That is intolerance, not non-acceptance. Intolerance is the use of force. Non-acceptance is holding a view that such a lifestyle is evil, but using words, rather than force, to convince people of this. 

 
 But you think homosexuals hold the view that homosexuals think of heterosexuality as evil, just as some heterosexuals view homosexuality?
 
 That's absurd!
Dzeron

But you think homosexuals hold the view that homosexuals think of heterosexuality as evil, just as some heterosexuals view homosexuality?
 
 That's absurd!

 
 I never said that, now, did I?
Tigerlilly

Nonacceptance and Intollerance basically have the same primary definitions according to the dictionary.
 
 nonacceptance
 
 \Non`ac*cept"ance\, n. A neglect or refusal to accept.
 
 Intolerance
 n 2. unwillingness to recognize and respect
 
 NO where does it differentiate between INtolerance and nonacceptance with the clarifier "force exertion."
JustineCredible

Dictionary or no, it really boils down to applied usage. Indeed, I tollerate many things of which I do not accept. I tollerate other families ways of child rearing of which I personally do not accept. I do not accept parents who allow their pre-teen daughters to dress like hookers, but I tollerate it because I am fairly well aware that it's simply a fashion fad that will fade just as disco did. 
 I tollerate the hoytie women with their completely selfish attitudes in the grocery store who bully their way down the aisles totally unaware that there just might be other shoppers there as well. I certainly do no accept this behavior, let alone participate in it. I tollerate it by not telling these women off in a public place, thusly setting a terrible example for my child. 
 
 In society we all tollerate many things of which we do not accept. 
 I tollerate public displays of affection, I do not accept them. I learned something a long time ago, which I feel all too many people have forgotten: If you have nothing nice to say, don't say anything at all. 
 Rudeness is far too common place.
MrWriteLA

I never said that, now, did I?

 
 You said:
You can't force straights to accept homosexuality for the same reasons that you can't force gays to accept heterosexuality.
And after that:
Non-acceptance is holding a view that such a lifestyle is evil

 
 My point is: Who are these gays who believe heterosexuality is an evil lifestyle?
 
 Answer: Except for some rare sociopath, perhaps -- none. The notion is absurd. Compared to legions of straights who DO believe that we're evil, whichfor some reason is considered understandable and excusable.
 
 Your analogy is meaningless, IMHO.
Tigerlilly

Dictionary or no, it really boils down to applied usage.

 
 Just as long as you recognize you are making up your own version of the word insomuch that it can then fit your needs.
jyoshu

Gays "don't accept" heterosexuality?? They're trying to deny heterosexuals their rights? Go "eww" whenever they see a heterosexual couple holding hands? Claim that heterosexuality is a sin, an abomination, a sickness? Bash them with baseball bats, crucify them on barbed wire in lonely Kansas fields, set them aflame on piles of tires? Picket their funerals with signs that say God hates them and they deserve to go to hell? Push for legislation that will prevent them from legally marrying? Blast them at every opportunity from their gay churches and on their gay cable networks? Fire them from jobs and deny them housing because they're straight? Protest because schools offer curricula depicting heterosexual couples? Boycott networks because they show a man and a woman kissing on TV? Try to force straight people to cure themselves of their "straightness" and become gay?

 
 Interesting how you take murderous and extremist elements of heterosexual people and lump in even people who simply excercize their right to voice moral concern into the same group.
 
 You are something else.
joebrummer

Interesting how you take murderous and extremist elements of heterosexual people and lump in even people who simply excercize their right to voice moral concern into the same group.
 
 You are something else.

 
 
 Isn't that exactly what James Dobsen does for a living with gays?
jyoshu

Isn't that exactly what James Dobsen does for a living with gays?

 
 Chains them to a fence and beats them with a ball bat?
 
 Um, no.
joebrummer

Chains them to a fence and beats them with a ball bat?
 
 Um, no.

 No takes the small portion of homosexuals and lumps them together with the whole.
BobNelson2

Interesting how you take murderous and extremist elements of heterosexual people and lump in even people who simply excercize their right to voice moral concern into the same group.

 
 The point, of course, is that the anti-gay spectrum, from the extreme of violence to the mild version of mere disapproval, has no parallel spectrum of opposition to heterosexuality in the gay community.
 
 We don't mind you folks AT ALL.
jyoshu

The point, of course, is that the anti-gay spectrum, from the extreme of violence to the mild version of mere disapproval, has no parallel spectrum of opposition to heterosexuality in the gay community.

 
 I don't think you can substantively say that there is a "spectrum" that is "anti-gay" (whatever that term means). One could easily argue that voicing concern over homosexuality is not "anti-gay" at all.
 
 I wouldn't put murderers on the same spectrum at all with such people.
JakeCJB

I don't think you can substantively say that there is a "spectrum" that is "anti-gay" (whatever that term means). One could easily argue that voicing concern over homosexuality is not "anti-gay" at all.
 

 
 Sometimes it's just being a busybody, or being insecure with one's own heterosexuality. What kind of concerns were you thinking of?
jyoshu

Sometimes it's just being a busybody, or being insecure with one's own heterosexuality. What kind of concerns were you thinking of?

 
 Concerns about the morality and whether or not the gay "lifestyle" (having gay relationships and sex) is harmful.
 
 But my point is that I just don't see how someone can honestly place most religious people who have such concerns with homosexuality in the same catagory as murderers. Don't you agree? After all, it's not good to judge all outspoken gay people by the actions of say, the killers of Jesse Dirkhising.
JakeCJB

Concerns about the morality and whether or not the gay "lifestyle" (having gay relationships and sex) is harmful.

 
 There's no need for concern, if one is not gay. I have a different morality and way of living than Christians, but I only need concern myself with it if I am Christian, or if Christians are trying to impose their morality on me by taking away my right to differ. If the church can't keep its gay people repressed or in the closet, it shouldn't expect the state to do its job.
 
 
But my point is that I just don't see how someone can honestly place most religious people who have such concerns with homosexuality in the same catagory as murderers. Don't you agree? After all, it's not good to judge all outspoken gay people by the actions of say, the killers of Jesse Dirkhising.

 
 I wouldn't say they are in the same cetegory as murderers. They are taking away rights, or working to take away rights, but obviously not to the same degree.
MrWriteLA

Interesting how you take murderous and extremist elements of heterosexual people and lump in even people who simply excercize their right to voice moral concern into the same group.
 
 You are something else.

 
 
 Interesting how you consistently and predictably take people's posts out of the context of the thread to try to portray them as extremists, immoral, in favor of child molestation, or whatever your mischaracterization-of-the-day is.
 
 Even more interesting is that you think no one sees through you, like a baby that covers its eyes and thinks that makes it invisible.
MrWriteLA

I challenge any poster on this forum to produce a link to even a single instance of a heterosexual being murdered, bashed, having his marriage protested or funeral picketed by a homosexual because they were straight.
 
 It's obvious to anyone who isn't in some sort of pathological denial that the opposite happens far too often in this country.
jyoshu

Interesting how you consistently and predictably take people's posts out of the context of the thread to try to portray them as extremists, immoral, in favor of child molestation, or whatever your mischaracterization-of-the-day is.
 
 Even more interesting is that you think no one sees through you, like a baby that covers its eyes and thinks that makes it invisible.

 
 Your inaccurate aversion aside, do you think putting murderers and those that go "eww" at the sight of hand-holding gay people in the same catagory is a good idea when responding to the charge that gays don't accept heterosexuality? It just seems to me that not accepting something and murdering someone over it are not even in the same ballpark.
 
 Just my thoughts.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  why tolerance?
